benchmark_details.name: Perturbation Framework for Evaluating and Enhancing the Robustness of Embedding Models Against Misinformation Edits
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces a perturbation framework that generates valid and natural claim variations to assess the robustness of sentence embedding models in a multi-stage retrieval pipeline and evaluate the effectiveness of various mitigation approaches.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve claim matching systems and provide reliable fact-checking of evolving misinformation.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset coverage is limited to claims encountered by fact-checkers, which may not represent the broader misinformation landscape.

data.source: CheckThat22, FactCheckTweet, OOD Dataset from Meedan
data.size: 3 datasets (CheckThat22: 2,592 claims, FactCheckTweet: 3,578 claims, OOD Dataset: 721 claims)
data.annotation: Manually verified for validity and naturalness.

methodology.calculation: Calculated using the similarity between claims and their corresponding fact-checks based on embedding models.
methodology.interpretation: Higher MAP indicates better retrieval performance of fact-checks relevant to the claims.
methodology.validation: Evaluated across various perturbation types to ensure robustness.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Claims used are publicly available and verified. No private data included.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Datasets used are accessible for research purposes.
